Row.Text: [B]Tropical Settlements[/B] were an important part of [B]Đại Việt's[/B] identity.

To carve cities and towns out of the waist of the world, where life overwhelms life, requires constant vigilance. In building their tropical cities, {1_Civilization_Adj} settlers emulate those already living there - clearing one’s own ground and holding it against the forces that seek to overwhelm.
[B]Lakshmibai[/B] was from the same continent as [B]Đại Việt[/B].
[B]Trung Trac[/B] was a ruler in ancient Vietnam.
